meanings.sent1: The rules were clear and establishable.
meanings.sent2: The new company policy was easily establishable.
meanings.sent3: The idea of a talking dog was not establishable.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness was an establishable fact.
meanings.sent5: The mountain's height was establishable by the climbers.

meanings.definition: Able to be proven or demonstrated.
meanings.sent1: The theory was not easily establishable.
meanings.sent3: The cat's ability to fly was not establishable.
meanings.sent4: His innocence was establishable beyond doubt.
meanings.sent5: The truth of her words was establishable through evidence.
